before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"45qag","text":"Ensure all materials to be used for this procedure are all ready and functional","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a1ql5","text":"SDS-PAGE (Sodium Dodecyl Sulphate polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis) is an electrophoresis method that allows protein separation by mass. The gel acts as a sieve through which the proteins move in response to an electric field.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fuvh","text":".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ain0","text":"SDS-PAGE allows an estimation of the purity of protein samples and can also be used in confirming the presence of a particular protein in a sample through its molecular weight by running it simultaneously on the gel with another protein of known molecular weight, called the standard or protein ladder. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7khl4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9bno","text":"SDS is an anionic detergent and is used to denature the proteins. The negative charges on SDS destroy most of the secondary and tertiary structure of proteins and are strongly attracted toward the anode in an electric field. Because the charge-to-mass ratio is nearly the same among SDS-denatured proteins, the final separation of proteins is almost entirely dependent on the differences in relative molecular weight (MW) of polypeptides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f73j3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co0jo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"9n8nn","text":"This protocol can be used to assess the protein purity by assessing presence of target vs contaminating bands on SDS-PAGE.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c35e7","text":"In our lab we typically use this protocol to confirm successful protein expression in preparing cellular reagents.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9up45","text":"In this protocol we use pre-cast TruPAGE gels","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bvind","text":"Reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fhu","text":"Loading buffer: {"blocks":[{"key":"8rl5r","text":"Preparing whole cell samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e3fg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqiuf","text":"After protein expression with IPTG or in autoinduction media, read the optical density at 600 nm (OD600 ) of the cell culture using a photometer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m5c7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35e7b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e60se","text":"Calculate the amount of culture to harvest to have a cell pellet equivalent to 1mL of OD600 =1 using the formula:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oao4","text":"Ci * Vi = Cf * Vf","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekfsq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"20u3b","text":"Transfer the amount of culture as calculated above in an appropriate tube and centrifuge it at 5,000 xg for 10 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17pdo","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d02m","text":"Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet in Doc lysis buffer (1mL per 0.1g of the pellet).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2t94","text":"Vortex intensively for 2 min at room temperature.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at41c","text":"Leave it shaking on a rotor at room temperature for 15mins.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ut66","text":"Then pellet the cells by centrifugation at 13000 rpm for 5 mins and carefully collect the supernatant which is our cell lysate for SDS PAGE analysis.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq689","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"699pk","text":"The OD600 reading should be within the linear range of the photometer. If the reading appears to be lower than 0.1 or higher than 0.9, dilute the cell sample accordingly in order to ensure the OD reading falls within the 0.1- 0.9 range.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2od9m","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5kqgo","text":"If you dilute or concentrate the sample remember to calculate the initial concentration (e.g. if you diluted 5 times the initial concentration is y*5, where y is the reading you obtained from the diluted concentration).","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"j4ft","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bdjnb","text":"where Ci means “initial concentration”, Cf means “final concentration”, Vi means \"initial volume\", and Vf means \"final volume \".","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":33,"offset":11,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4e16h","text":"Therefore:( yOD600 ) * x mL = 1 OD600* 1 mL ","type":"align-center"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f13j","text":"where Y is the OD600 reading and X is the volume to be calculated. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":44}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":54,"offset":10,"style":"bold"}],"key":"d5upd","text":"Therefore, x mL = ( 1 * 1 )/y  (multiply by   to convert to ul).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ddreh","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"CC6FDA20117D11ED92EFB32C20D9668C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"54FF9B30118A11ED92EFB32C20D9668C","height":205,"id":276821,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iqkzbq77x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iqkxbq77x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iqkybq77x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iqkwbq77x.webp","width":245}}}}

1.0 μg is sufficient to visualize purified proteins and 10 μg is sufficient to visualize proteins in lysates on a Coomassie stained gel.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1st48","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":181}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":31,"style":"bold"}],"key":"6sk4h","text":"For example: Using the formula CiVi=CfVf, we can find out what concentration of cell lysate is required to load a sample with a final concentration of 15 ug/uL in a total volume of  . ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"907j8","text":"If we use 30 uL of cell lysate;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":27,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"aoqod","text":"Ci*30 uL=(15 ug/uL)*(50 uL)","type":"align-center"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":39,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"d6vao","text":"Therefore; Ci= (15 ug/uL)*(50 uL)/30 uL","type":"align-center"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":11,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"b2j87","text":"Ci=25 ug/uL","type":"align-center"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"4C543820117F11ED92EFB32C20D9668C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","5_3":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","6_2":"","6_3":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Reagents","Amounts (ul)","Ex. 50ul reaction"],["Protein Sample","x","30"],["4x sample buffer","12.5","12.5"],["DTT (1M)","3.5","3.5"],["Sterilised distilled water","34-x","4"],["Total volume","50","50"]],"guid":"08C9EB70118011ED81C70A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagents","Amounts (ul)","Ex. 50ul reaction"],["Protein Sample","x","30"],["4x sample buffer","12.5","12.5"],["DTT (1M)","3.5","3.5"],["Sterilised distilled water","34-x","4"],["Total volume","50","50"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ulo2","text":"Setting up the apparatus","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70ptf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21jc3","text":"Rinse the gel wells with sterile distilled water. TruPAGE wells MUST be rinsed prior to loading samples for removal of trace storage buffer to achieve optimal band resolution and sharpness.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12rf0","text":"Remember to peel off the white tape at the bottom of the gel cassette prior to loading samples.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c13ti","text":"Place Precast gel into apparatus and secure as appropriate;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"covhg","text":"Fill the cathode chamber with 1X running buffer and ensure a proper seal prior to filling the anode chamber.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g3h3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bk6c","text":"Loading the wells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4cip","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12i80","text":"Load the samples into the wells. Do not exceed well capacity when loading samples, 35 uL for 12 well gels and 20 uL for 10 well gels (For TruPAGE gels).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48d3t","text":"Note: Use thin gel-loading tips for better settling of the samples towards the bottom of the wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"difie","text":"Load 10 µl of MW marker in the left most lane.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4m1ca","text":"Load 10-30 µl of samples depending on well capacity and purity of the protein in subsequent wells. Load less for purified proteins (10 uL) and more for cell lysates (20 uL). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":97,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hva3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"15rr4","text":"Running the Gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61jvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb7c1","text":"Once the samples are loaded and buffer chambers are filled, cover the chamber and firmly connect both the anode and the cathode. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5d27s","text":"Set the voltage on the electrophoresis power supply to a constant voltage of 180 V. Turn ON the power supply.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77kvd","text":"Run the gel at constant voltage (180 V) until the blue dye front reaches the bottom of the gel cassette.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kdcg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hmbl","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"48ap1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7j4v6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D0AB6832118E11ED81C70A58A9FEAC02","height":0,"id":"CE6BE880118E11ED847E37E915544997","is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/k2co9T5FBluBzw9-muH_l5eu44tn_UEweVUKqtSTcKwQCwDm4fQYxg2dLOrgZU9jVDHUdyr2JGE8sLvaY5rFqpHEzzuNoHQuvg95fL5Ov_hVs8n3i_pPKTZPXAZ--P3wCW-HsI_qGFvfhrZXy-oQtA","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/k2co9T5FBluBzw9-muH_l5eu44tn_UEweVUKqtSTcKwQCwDm4fQYxg2dLOrgZU9jVDHUdyr2JGE8sLvaY5rFqpHEzzuNoHQuvg95fL5Ov_hVs8n3i_pPKTZPXAZ--P3wCW-HsI_qGFvfhrZXy-oQtA","width":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8gp6l","text":"Do not touch the electrophoresis unit while power is on. If the buffer is leaking from the unit be certain to turn power OFF before making contact with the buffer. Use care at all times.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4pupa","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"19g9m","text":"Depending on the gel percentage and running buffer, run times can range from 30–70 minutes. Expected current during the gel run should remain below 110 mA/gel (maximum: 20 W) and will decrease gradually as the run progresses.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"em7l1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sm4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9faet","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f2nd8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arlu4","text":"Prepare Coomassie Brilliant Blue G-250 stain solution as directed above.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qm0t","text":"After running the gel, remove the gel from the cassette. This can be tricky, use a spatula to pry open the cassette carefully not to break the gel.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvu43","text":"Heat 100 mL of sterilized autoclaved water for 1 minute on high (600 W).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fb5fh","text":"Wash the gel with warm ultrapure water for 3 to 5 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35t6u","text":"Repeat warm water wash thrice.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cd1e8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d40v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"frs26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o3f6","text":"Heat 25 mL of stain solution for 20 seconds on high (600 W). Place the gel in the warm stain solution and incubate for 30 minutes with gentle agitation.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ufas","text":"Pour off the staining solution and add 50-100ml bi distilled water in order to de-stain the light blue background on the gel. Place on a shaker and replace water if necessary for further de-staining.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"794fn","text":"If the gel is stained for more than 30mins, warm 100 mL of de-stain solution (10% ethanol) for 30 seconds on high (600 W). Remove gel from stain solution and de-stain for 15 minutes to 16 hours. The duration of de-staining depends on the gel type used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":195,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"364qo","text":"Document the gel (take a clear picture).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":86,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5a9rd","text":"This is a heated procedure (50–70 C) and the volumes in this procedure are for 1 gel. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":115,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4gmkh","text":"Do not heat the gel to temperatures ABOVE 70 C, as the stain solution may get too hot and dissolve the gel matrix. ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"39h8q","text":"Washing steps are very important for proper visualization of the protein. Residual SDS inhibits protein staging in gels that are not washed long enough.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Assessing protein purity using SDS PAGE
title_html: Assessing protein purity using SDS PAGE

versions.title: Assessing protein purity using SDS PAGE
versions.title_html: Assessing protein purity using SDS PAGE

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0362","text":"Wear protective clothing (Lab coat, gloves, face masks)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vkpe","text":"Take extra caution if you have to cast your own gels","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tha5","text":"Extra care should be employed when handling HCL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
